title: Nightly regression: False-positive `dead_code` warning for fields used in Debug output
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
#[derive(Debug)]
enum MyError {
    MyVariant { more_info: &'static str },
}

fn main() {
    my_function().unwrap()
}

fn my_function() -> Result<(), MyError> {
    Err(MyError::MyVariant { more_info: "hello" })
}
```

I expected to see this happen: No dead code warning, since `more_info` is emitted in the debug output when panicking. This is, in fact, the behavior on current stable.

Instead, this happened (on current nightly):
```
warning: field is never read: `more_info`
 --> src/main.rs:3:17
  |
3 |     MyVariant { more_info: &'static str },
  |                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(dead_code)]` on by default
```

Reproduction on Rust Playground: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=a0c9dd25de81250cead3d61a16f99497

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.57.0-nightly (a8f2463c6 2021-10-09)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a8f2463c68a6532d74a13ec402ec5b513e4e2726
commit-date: 2021-10-09
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.57.0-nightly
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```

The bug does not appear on current stable, as you can see by toggling the compiler version in the Rust Playground link above.

Possibly related: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/89717 (the code triggering the issue is somewhat different, but it's another dead_code false positive that just showed up on nightly).

Thank you!
